Role Overview
The ANZ Finance & Performance Reporting Manager leads the financial reporting, performance analysis, and data analytics functions across the Australia and New Zealand business. This role is accountable for delivering timely, accurate, and insightful reporting to support strategic and operational decision-making, while driving continuous improvement in data integrity, systems, and reporting processes. As a key member of the Finance leadership team, the position serves as the critical link between operational business units and corporate finance, providing the analytical frameworks, performance insights, and governance that enable effective management of business performance across the region.


Responsibilities:


Lead the delivery of accurate and timely financial reporting across all ANZ business units, ensuring compliance with AASB and IFRS standards.
Oversee month-end, quarter-end and year-end processes, consolidations, and executive management reporting.
Drive financial governance, variance analysis, and performance insights to support strategic and operational decision-making.
Develop and maintain data analytics and BI reporting solutions (Power BI, Tableau) that enhance visibility of business performance across corporate and franchise divisions.
Partner with business leaders to deliver budgets, rolling forecasts, and scenario modelling aligned to corporate strategy.
Champion data accuracy, control frameworks, and system integrity across ERP, BI, and consolidation tools.
Collaborate cross-functionally with Operations, Finance, IT, and Shared Services to improve reporting processes and the quality of financial information.
Provide commercial and analytical support to drive revenue performance and continuous improvement across the multi-site network.


Candidate Profile
You are a CPA/CA qualified professional currently working as an FP&A/Reporting/Insights Manager with extensive budgeting and forecasting experience in a complex multi-site business. You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and a flare for commercial business partnering and you are a strong driver for positive change. Your personality is energetic and you have robust influencing skills. Technically you feel comfortable challenging business models and you have extensive budgeting and forecasting experience. Experience with large ERPs such as SAP or Oracle would be advantageous. You will also bring technical expertise in TM1, Power BI and visualisations for presentations to the ELT.


Culture & Benefits
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Finance & Performance Reporting Manager to join an innovative global giant and be part of a team that supports business growth. This organisation is known for being people focused and prides itself on being committed to serving the consumer products industry across the world. This Finance & Performance Reporting Manager will directly support the ELT in managing the management reporting, planning, and analytics function across the ANZ regions. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced commercial leader with extensive management reporting and budgeting, and forecasting experience to join a global brand name in an environment that fosters a standard of excellence.

So, what’s the role?

The Senior Change Analyst will design and deliver business change activities that are aligned to our strategic priorities and that impact our people, Member-facing teams and Members.

Working in the change delivery practice within the Transformation function, you will collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and analyse impacts resulting from the delivery of changes such as new systems, technology, business processes and regulatory change and prepare them by implementing activities that support change readiness and successful adoption.
 

In a typical day, you’ll get to:

Analyse and evaluate the business impact of planned transformational change initiatives.
Work with delivery teams (including BAs, vendors) and stakeholders to translate requirements and solutions into business change outcomes.
Design and execute communication and engagement activities based on impact assessments and agreed change strategies and plans.
Draft compelling content and communications for all manner of media.
Create high impact and high-quality collateral such as presentation packs, quick reference guides, training materials, instructional videos, sharepoint sites etc.
Champion and drive the delivery of sustainable change, supporting teams and stakeholders to integrate and embed the changes within their business areas.
Support the translation of business and technical change into meaningful training proposals and plans.
Identify, evaluate, and escalate potential risks, points of resistance, engagement or adoption issues and propose solutions to address these.
 

About you

2+ years change management experience in Transformation programs with a solid understanding and application of change management frameworks and disciplines.
Experience conducting change analysis and business impact assessments to inform the change plan, tracking activities to schedule, with measures and monitors in place.
Demonstrated experience supporting and executing change activities on business transformation initiatives, particularly involving technology, process or regulatory change and people and Member-facing team adoption.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, cope under pressure, juggle competing deadlines and thrive in a regulated, fast-moving environment.
Demonstrated ability to produce high quality, high impact collateral, presentations and training content to achieve cut through and seamless execution of the change.
Strong team player, with the ability to collaborate with others to deliver positive outcomes.

For-purpose, a bank committed to helping its Members and their community.

Work with values-driven leaders, who actively develop talent and support you to grow your career. In an environment that you are empowered to Be Bold. Be Different. Be Sustainable. Be YOU!

Hybrid working from our state-of-the-art offices to connect and collaborate, as well as focused time at home.
Competitive remuneration with an additional one week ‘Be You’ leave, ‘Be Well’ wellbeing benefit, #BFF Club home loan offer and free on-site parking!

About us

The Australian Institute of Family Studies (AIFS, or ‘the Institute’) is the Australian Government's key research advisory agency in the area of family wellbeing. It is an independent statutory authority established in 1980 under the Family Law Act 1975. It is also home to the Australian Gambling Research Centre (AGRC), established under the Gambling Measures Act 2012 which builds the evidence base on gambling-related harm. The Institute is an agency within the portfolio of the Department of Social Services (DSS).

AIFS’ approach to research is applied and policy relevant, coming from a tradition of social science and strengthened by our multidisciplinary expertise. We draw together expertise from a broad range of disciplines including sociology, psychology, social work, economics, political science, demography, law, public health and data science. Our research is generated through a combination of AIFS initiated and commissioned projects.

Our AIFS initiated and led research allows us to respond to critical trends and emerging issues for families in Australia and contribute independent insights to inform policy and practice.

Our commissioned research for government departments and agencies addresses specific policy questions and program needs, drawing on our multidisciplinary research expertise and methodological rigour.

About our Themes

As a Theme Head at AIFS, you will be expected to demonstrate deep policy and research expertise in one of the Institute’s key research areas, depending on the theme you are applying for. 

Research Themes

There are 4 key research themes related to our core legislative functions. The first 3 themes apply to our core function as the leading Institution for family studies in Australia. 

1. Child and Family Wellbeing

2. Child and Family Safety

3. Families and Society

4. Gambling Harm

AIFS has a secondary function under the Gambling Measures Act 2012.

Enabled under the Family Law Act 1975, AIFS is the leading institution for family studies in Australia. 

Position Requirements

The Theme Head is a senior research leadership role responsible for the strategic and scientific direction of a designated research theme at AIFS. This role ensures the delivery of high-quality, policy-relevant evidence that informs government decision-making and contributes to improved outcomes for children, families, and communities.

The Theme Head sets the vision for the theme, leads strategic planning, and ensures alignment with AIFS’s Strategic Research Agenda. They are accountable for the coherence, innovation, and impact of research within the theme, and contribute to cross-theme collaboration and strategic initiatives.

This role involves managing senior researchers and research teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performing research culture, and supporting career development. The Theme Head actively engages with senior government officials and external stakeholders to influence policy and translate research into practice.

Strong commercial acumen and business development capabilities are essential, including leading large-scale funding proposals, identifying strategic opportunities, and building partnerships that support the Institute’s long-term objectives. 

The Theme Head maintains an active research profile and contributes to the scientific leadership of AIFS. This includes active networking and promotion of AIFS work both in person as well as through key channels such as LinkedIn.

Strategic Leadership

• Leads specific theme strategy and sets vision and direction for this area.

• Works collectively with other Theme Heads and leaders of our longitudinal studies to:

- lead the AIFS Strategic Research Agenda, jointly considering all current and future research work to ensure it aligns to AIFS priorities

- configure and lead multi-disciplinary teams from across the theme streams as required to progress research and evidence projects

- champion a collective capability mindset that enables a OneAIFS approach to all work
